item.title: Ticket #2291 (When you have some FF extensions installed TinyMCEs popups are too narrow) closed
item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
invalid:

User config problem, not a bug in WordPress or TinyMCE.

I'm using SessionSaver. I just checked for updates and there were none. I do not have this problem. It looks to me like a configuration issue and not something that can be fixed in TinyMCE.

That window is supposed to be a modal window, not treated the same as other browser windows. Browser extensions should know better than to treat it the same. Unfortunately, I don't think there's anything we can do to get around a bad extension.

item.title: tiny_mce_popup.gif attached to Ticket #2291
item.dc:creator: simonwheatley
item.description: Screengrab of the issue with SearchStatus enabled.

item.title: Ticket #2291 (When you have some FF extensions installed TinyMCEs popups are too narrow) updated
item.dc:creator: simonwheatley
item.description: SessionSaver "dl * nightly 30" appears to fix the issue for that extension.

item.title: Ticket #2291 (When you have some FF extensions installed TinyMCEs popups are too narrow) created
item.dc:creator: simonwheatley
item.description:
Running FF1.5 with SessionSaver 0.2.1.030.4 and/or SearchStatus 1.14 and WP2.0 the TinyMCE "edit link" popup is too narrow. Disabling the extensions fixes this issue.

These extension versions appear to be the most recent.

item.title: Ticket #2290 (no email notification of comments) updated
item.dc:creator: zazen
item.description: Version changed

item.title: Ticket #2290 (no email notification of comments) created
item.dc:creator: zazen
item.description:
I've asked in the support forum and searched here and not found answers.

Since I upgraded to wp 2.0 I don't receive email notification of comments. I've found where this was fixed in the last version, but it isn't working again and I can't seem to find a current support ticket listed.

All comments, or at least comments by new people, are being held for moderation.

The options for both of these are set properly.

item.title: Ticket #2277 (Ditch RDF and RSS 0.92) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: People like and use atom. No point ditching something people use.

item.title: Ticket #2288 (Reenable cache for safe_mode hosts) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: BTW, you can't use get_option() in the cache because the cache is loaded and initialized before everything except $wpdb.

item.title: Ticket #2288 (Reenable cache for safe_mode hosts) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: We could have ENABLE_CACHE be a force-enable flag that skips the safe_mode check.

item.title: Ticket #2277 (Ditch RDF and RSS 0.92) updated
item.dc:creator: Denis-de-Bernardy
item.description:
Component changed

+1

+1 to ditch Atom too. Atom is a dead end technology. MS, AOL and Yahoo all chose RSS. Google is providing RSS and Atom. Plus, having several formats confuses users, and I cannot name a single feed reader who cannot understand both formats.

item.title: Ticket #2277 (Ditch RDF and RSS 0.92) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: +1 We need: RSS 2.0, Atom 1.0, and MAYBE Atom 0.3... but probably not.

item.title: Ticket #2288 (Reenable cache for safe_mode hosts) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Keywords changed

Agreed, there shouldn't be a blanket condition there. Could we change 

if (ini_get('safe_mode'))

to 

if (ini_get('safe_mode') && get_option('safe_mode_no_cache'))

Then people with safe mode, who knew what they were doing, could just pop over to wp-admin/options.php (we wouldn't display this option by default in the admin) and change it to true?

item.title: Ticket #2289 (Char Encoding in inline-uploading.php) created
item.dc:creator: schestowitz
item.description:
There appears to be an issue with charcater encoding in inline-uploading.php. The labels are badly encoded as the image illustrates. It is only the uploads iframe which is relevant here.

​http://www.schestowitz.com/temp/sites/encoding_problem.jpg

I'm afraid that I can't offer a patch, but I did have a careful look and tried pinpointing the culprit.

item.title: Ticket #2287 (embed content stripped when posting through XML-RPC) created
item.dc:creator: RandomNumbers
item.description: I have used Audioblog.com in previous vrsions to embed audio into posts. Since upgrading to 2.0, audioblog posts are stripped of everything but the text, rendering them useless for their purpose. Something in the WP2.0 is stripping the embedded player from posts made through XML-RPC from outside.

item.title: Ticket #2268 (get_option() on non-existent option always invokes new query) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
+	if (wp_cache_get($setting, 'notoptions')) {
+		return;

This should return false;

check out the corresponding code from 1.5.2: 

		if ( isset($cache_nonexistantoptions[$setting]) )
			return false;

KSES is working properly. Please use the API to modify the allowedposttags array, or give your users unfiltered_html caps.

item.title: Ticket #2268 (get_option() on non-existent option always invokes new query) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description:
Keywords changed

Attached patch is a simple way of doing this just for options: if the option isn't found it just caches it in the notoptions group, which is checked before doing a query. We might need something more generalised, but its a start.

item.title: 2268.diff attached to Ticket #2268
item.dc:creator: davidhouse

item.title: Ticket #2286 (WPG2 tags are stripped out in classic editor) created
item.dc:creator: stephenju
item.description:
When a member that is Author or below, the <WPG2> tags in the post he/she is editing in classic editor are stripped when the post is saved. If the member is an Editor or Admin, then the tags are preserved.

<WPG2> tags are custom tags added by the WPG2 plug-in. They are preserved when using tinyMCE if a plugin from WPG2 community is installed.

item.title: Ticket #2285 (Wpautop strips blank lines) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Now, for the fix, we could leave anything more than two line breaks as <br/>s instead of trying to paragraph them. We could do the same for more than one space: convert them all to  .

fixed:

Fixed by upgrading to WordPress 2.0

item.title: Ticket #2285 (Wpautop strips blank lines) updated
item.dc:creator: davidhouse
item.description: Thanks Mark. I aksed him to do that: please don't assign tickets to people without their permission. There are more people than matt that can fix your bug. If matt decides he wants to fix it, he can accept it.

item.title: Ticket #2285 (Wpautop strips blank lines) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Owner changed

item.title: Ticket #2285 (Wpautop strips blank lines) created
item.dc:creator: linickx
item.description:
Non-Techie users like to user spaces & carrige returns for formatting text.

Using the WYSIWYG gui, if you use carrige return 3 times in a text - hoping to create some white space between text - i.e. like entering text1<br /><br /><br />text2 or <p>text1</p><p> </p><p> </p><p> </p><p>text2</p> - the gui removes them and replace with single <p>text1</p><p>text2</p> which is one line of white space.

I understand that this kind of use may not be best practice, but it's the kind of thing normal users do, and wp is supposed to be a good all round user experience.

item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: edit page hooks.diff attached to Ticket #2284
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description: Patch to add new hooks to the manage pages table.

item.title: Ticket #2284 (Extra Hooks in the Edit Page Table) created
item.dc:creator: majelbstoat
item.description: This patch adds hooks so that plugin defined columns can be added to the manage pages table, like can currently be done with the manage posts table. It adds two new hooks: 'manage_pages_columns' and 'manage_pages_custom_column', which can be called in exactly the same way (and possibly with the same callback function) as 'manage_posts_columns' and 'manage_posts_custom_column'. It also moves all table row generation code into pagerows() regardless of if a search is being conducted or not, improving consistency and ease of future alterations.

item.title: revised-https-patch.php attached to Ticket #2283
item.dc:creator: michaelmoore
item.description: patch for 1 erroneous line in make_url_footnote from earlier https support patch

item.title: Ticket #2283 (Error in patch for https support will prevent absolute URL footnotes ...) created
item.dc:creator: michaelmoore
item.description: The patches I submitted for https support which were incorporated in revision 3041 contain an error that will prevent URL footnotes with absolute URLs from being displayed properly. A further patch correcting the error is attached. Sorry.
